intro: Fleurya ruderalis, commonly known as the common fleurya, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils, such as along roadsides or in urban environments, showcasing its adaptability to ruderal habitats. Its small, white flowers bloom in early spring, and it produces small, round seeds that are dispersed by wind. Fleurya ruderalis is often considered a weed but plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local insect populations.
